alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rensselaer; Eastern Schenectady; Montgomery; Northern Saratoga; Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren; Southern Fulton; Southern Saratoga; Southern Washington; Western Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 10:13PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WITH EMBEDDED SNOW SQUALLS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF WARREN...SARATOGA...WASHINGTON...BENNINGTON...MONTGOMERY AND RENSSELAER COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of snow showers with embedded snow squalls accompanied by winds of up to 45 MPH, which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. Precipitation will begin as rain in lower elevations before quickly changing to snow. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1012 PM EDT, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 6 miles east of Schroon Lake to Amsterdam and moving east at 45 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Rogers Rock Campground around 1020 PM EDT. Hague around 1025 PM EDT. East Glenville and Burnt Hills around 1030 PM EDT. Country Knolls around 1035 PM EDT. West Haven around 1040 PM EDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 near exit 27. Interstate 87 between exits 10 and 25. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
